news_header: Donald Trump is threatening to impose high tariffs on EU car imports due to low American car sales in Europe, attributing this to factors like the size of US vehicles and higher fuel prices in Europe.
news_original_title: Why don't Europeans buy more American cars?
news_text: Despite the imbalance in trade, with more EU cars exported to the US than vice versa, Trump argues for fairer trading rules. European carmakers are adapting by manufacturing in North America, while US companies are shifting focus to electric vehicles. The European market is competitive and complex, with local brands having an advantage, and tariffs may not be the solution for improving the US car industry's position.
